channel.description: Recent content in Currently-Reading on Strat

item.title: Existential Psychotherapy
item.description: An absolute brick of a text expounding on a psychotherapy framework based on dealing with the four main existentialist issues of death, freedom, isolation and meaninglessness. Pretty enlightening so far, it’s even got a description of existentialism that human beings can understand!

item.title: Kobold Guide to Gamemastering
item.description: A collection of essays about GMing. Offers some good tips and tricks but it’s not as comprehensive or as much of a must-read as So You Want To Be A Game Master?

item.title: Astro City
item.description: Superhero anthology with great art. Focuses on bringing heroes down to earth while maintaining the wonder and awe of superpowers. Astro City is a reconstruction of the superhero genre instead of a deconstruction. It’s a precursor to comics like Invincible and the Boys.

item.title: ODY-C
item.description:
Gender-swapped psychedelic sci-fi comic book version of Homer’s Odyssey?

Sounds crazy. I’m into it.

item.title: Critical Directions In Comics Studies
item.description: Collection of academic articles in comics studies. Starts with a great comic strip introducing the collection itself followed by comic panels drawn by the authors of the articles themselves. Very cool!

item.title: Doom Patrol
item.description: Grant Morrison’s run of Doom Patrol focuses on the misfits, the weird and the broken and how they are fit to fight evils that other more conventional and sane heroes aren’t equipped to deal with.

item.title: The Word For World Is Forest
item.description:
Seems like Ursula K. Le Guin is subverting the old school military science fiction trope of humans going around killing “aliens” with the humans doing the killing framed as the good guys who we’re supposed to be rooting for. Maybe colonialism is bad?

Let’s see how this goes.

item.title: Under The Dome
item.description: Stephen King’s still got it. Better than ever really. A small American town is trapped under a gigantic forcefield (the Dome), hijinks ensues.
